msDesc.head: A Augustine, Ps.-Augustine, etc.; printed book [Speyer, c. 1472]. B Devotional and theological treatises; Germany (Regensberg), 1473

physDesc.p: Composite: two parts: fols. 1–28 (printed book) || fols. 29–98

binding.p: Modern sewing; bound in German(?) dark gray patterned paper over pasteboards; the flat spine blank except for the shelfmark.

history.provenance: The two parts were presumably bound together from the beginning, as Part A has rubrics by Johannes Tüchler, who wrote Part B.
Perhaps belonged to the hospital of St Katherine in Regensburg, as suggested by Bod-Inc and MEI.
Probably identifiable as Sotheby's, 30 May 1840 ('... rare and curious books ... consigned from Germany'), lot 47.
history.acquisition: Purchased by the Bodeian for 10 shillings (Books Purchased (1840), 3). Former Bodleian shelfmarks: ‘VII. Q. 4. 44.’ (front pastedown), i.e. printed book Auct. 7Q 4.44; handed over to the Department of Western Manuscripts and accessioned with the current shelfmark on ‘15.iv.[19]41.’ (fol. 1r). Cf. ‘Notable Accessions’, BLR, 1 no. 15 (1941), 255–58.

recordHist.source: Summary description by Peter Kidd (March 2021), edited by Matthew Holford. Previously described in unpublished typescript by Bodleian Library staff, n.d.

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

msItem.note: Augustine and Pseudo-Augustine, De fuga mulierum, De continentia, De contemptu mundi, etc.
Printed at Speyer c. 1472. Cf. GKW, no. 2956; ISTC ia01280000; MEI 00212060; Bod-Inc A-577
Rubrics in the hand of Johannes Tüchler, for whom see below.

msItem.author: Jean Gerson
msItem.title: De pollutione nocturna et praeparatione ad missam
msItem.rubric: Tractatus magistri Iohanis Gerson Cancellarii Parisiensis de pollucione
msItem.incipit: Dubitatum est apud me frequenter et diu
msItem.explicit: Et hoc est omnis homo deo gratiarum digne super reddat acciones. Amen.
msItem.colophon: : Explicit tractatulus … de trepidantibus celebrare et de pollutionibus &c per me Johanem tüchler tunc temporis socium diuinorum Ratisbone in hospitali in pede pontis die Martis xx Iulij anno lxxiij
msItem.bibl: Jean Gerson, Œuvres complètes, ed. Glorieux, 9 (Paris, 1973), no. 425 pp. 35–50

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Formula honestae uitae
msItem.rubric: Incipit speculum beati Bernhardi abbatis de honestate vite
msItem.incipit: Petis a me fili et frater quod nunquam et nusquam aliquem a suo prouisore audiui petisse
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit speculum beati Bernhardi de honestate vite

msItem.author: Arnulfus de Boeriis (Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux)
msItem.title: Octo puncta perfectionis assequendae
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt octo puncta mediante quibus peruenitur ad perfeccionem vite spiritualis cuiusdam scilicet Bernhardi
msItem.explicit: esto cautus contra insidias diaboli ne te abducat ab eis.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt octo puncta beato Bernhardi ad discipulum suum …

msItem.title: Sermon on the Assumption
msItem.rubric: De assumpcione Marie virginis sermo bonus
msItem.incipit: Que est ista que ascendit de deserto Cant VI. Hec verba locutus est salomon in persona supernorum
msItem.explicit: ad eternam vitam. Ad quam nos perducere dignetur pater et filius et spiritus sanctus. Amen

msItem.title: ‘Liber caritatis’
msItem.note: Consisting mainly of a series of prayers, in three parts
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber caritatis seu tractatulus caritatis beati Dominici predicatoris eximii
msItem.incipit: Legimus in libro de vita sancti dominici predicatoris eximii quod requisitus de predicationum sublimitate
O sapiencia eterna, splendor glorie et figura substancie
msItem.explicit: nec ulla fortune sors separet sed permaneat morte fortior noster amor in evum. Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber caritatis beati Dominici predicatoris eximii.
msItem.note: Cf. Mainz, StaatsBibl., Hs I 154, fols. 198v–199r, and Munich, BSB, Clm 544, fols. 151v–161v.
Fols. 63v–64v are blank, fol. 65 is the start of a new quire

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Speculum peccatoris
msItem.incipit: Quoniam karissimi. In via huius vite fugientis sumus Nostri dies sicut umbra pretereunt
msItem.explicit: et cum domino nostro Ihesu Christo vitam eternam possideatis. Amen. Qui cum patre … secula seculorum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit speculum mortis beati Augustini episcopi memorijs hominum intime commendandum
msItem.note: Pr. PL 40 cols. 983–992; Stegmüller, RB, II, no. 1481

msItem.title: Norma uiuendi
msItem.rubric: Epistola sew libellus honorabilis Ysidori de norma vite ad quendam adolescentem
msItem.incipit: Age fili ut oportet, age ut decet, age ut dignum est
msItem.explicit: Vide deinceps ne quod bonum quod cepisti despicias
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit libellus honorabilis Ysidori de norma vite &c.

msItem.author: Patrick of Dublin
msItem.title: De tribus habitaculis animae
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus Augustini de tribus tabernaculis
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt sub omnipotentis dei manu habitacula Primum, ijmum, et medium
msItem.explicit: benigum et misericordem Cui est honor et gloria et nunc et semper per omnia secula seculorum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit libellus Augustini Aurelii de tribus tabernaculis 1473
msItem.note: Ed. A. Gwynn, Script. Lat. Hibern. 1, pp.106–124; PL 40 cols. 991–998

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Meditationes piissimae de cognitione humanae conditionis
msItem.incipit: Multi multa sciunt et se ipsos nesciunt
msItem.explicit: unum eumdemque dominum glorie qui vivit et regnat per infinita secula. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit meditacio sancti Bernhardi abbatis de custodia sui quam misit ad amicum suum &c.

msItem.colophon: In vigilia xj milium virginum [20 Oct.] per me Johannem Tüchler de Saltendorff tunc temporis indignum presbiterum in hospitali in Ratispone in pede pontis extra muros civitatis Anno MºCCCCºlxxiiiº

supportDesc.support: Paper, with a narrow parchment MS. waste reinforcement strip at the centre of each quire; apparently one watermark (clearest on fols. 63 and 99), bull's head with crown and seven-petalled flower, type Piccard Ochsenkopf XV.358.

layoutDesc.layout: No ruling visible, written with 26–29 long lines per page

handDesc.handNote: Gothic cursive, the hand of Johannes Tüchler.

history.provenance: Written by Johannes Tüchler of Saltendorff, of the Spitalkirche St Katharina, next to the Steinerne Brücke, Regensburg, in 1473: with his colophons dated 20 July 1473 (fol. 39r), 1473 (fol. 80v), and 20 Oct. 1473 (fol. 98v).
